Byte-code

The Hello, World! program, created in the previous step, might look like a simple ol' Win32 Application, it is, but only, to a certain extent. For instance, if these resulting hello.exe executable files were to be run on a computer where .Net Framework is not installed, an error would state that exact fact. These files contain a CLR header that makes them run under the CLR virtual machine. The CLR, then, reads the CIL byte-code contained in hello.exe file and executes it.

Differences

Although the Hello, World! program has the same purpose and the same desired and actual output, in all the languages, the results of each compilation is quite different. Just by looking at the size of the result hello.exe executable file, one can tell there are differences.

Language Code file size hello.exe size
ILAsm 212 2048
C# 129 3548
F# 44 4096
VB.Net 109 6656

Sizes are in bytes and just sample results.

There are many reasons for these differences. They will be analysed further ahead...thoroughly.
